name: Rengar

sources.import_notes: Generated baseline canonical champion file from From Online dataset.

notes: Ability effects are intentionally minimal placeholders until scripted modeling is added.

passive.name: Unseen Predator
passive.description: Innate:  Rengar generates Ferocity when he casts a basic ability or uses  Savagery's empowered attack, which expires after a period out of combat. At max Ferocity, his next basic ability consumes them to become empowered with an additional effect, gain an extra cast, and briefly grant him  bonus movement speed.
passive.description_source:
The start of the leap is considered to be the end of Rengar's attack windup, triggering attack effects (i.e.  Navori Flickerblade,  Lethal Tempo) and generating the Ferocity.
While  grounded or  rooted, Rengar loses the enhanced  attack range from Unseen Predator.
Rengar will only leap to a target if his basic attack timer has been refreshed (if not so he will not automatically attempt to path towards his target, despite them being within leap range).
Only  Flash and  Hexflash instantly end Unseen Predator. Other effects (i.e  Teleport) will still cause the buff to linger upon leaving  brush.
Rengar can freely use any  abilities, summoner spells, or item actives while leaping.
Using a  dash or  blink ability will interrupt the leap.
The attack from the leap will:
Not go off if the dash was interrupted.
Go off at the end of the dash even if its normal destination is obstructed by boundaries he cannot cross (e.g. terrain,  The Hextech Ultimatum).
Go off regardless of distance the enemy travels away from Rengar's original location.
Go off even if Rengar loses  sight of the target.
Go off but have no effect if the target dies or becomes  untargetable.
When the attack goes off,  Savagery's empowered attack is consumed.
The attack deals  basic damage but is considered  ability damage for  Spear of Shojin.
 Rapid Firecannon's and  Savagery's bonus ranges are lost after 0.25 seconds upon gaining Unseen Predator, and are re-gained after 0.25 seconds upon losing Unseen Predator.
Rengar has a secondary resource bar that indicates how much Ferocity he currently has as pips.
Ferocity generated by Unseen Predator has a purple color.
Ferocity generated by his other abilities has a white color.
Bonetooth Necklace uses different icons corresponding to the number of stacks acquired:
1 Stack: 
2 Stacks: 
3 Stacks: 
4 Stacks: 
5 Stacks: 
6th Stack:  Head of Kha'Zix

basic_ability_1.name: Savagery
basic_ability_1.description: Active:  Rengar gains  bonus attack speed for his next two  basic attacks. His next basic attack deals bonus physical damage and will  critically strike, dealing increased damage based on his  critical strike chance.
basic_ability_1.description_source:
Savagery deals  basic damage, but also triggers spell effects by also being tagged as  spell damage.
Savagery's empowered attack is consumed against jungle plants.
The bonus attack speed from the unempowered and empowered casts can stack with each other, if both are cast shortly one after another.
The enhanced attack applies other  on-hit effects as well as  life steal as normal.
Casting Savagery does not  break stealth.

basic_ability_2.name: Battle Roar
basic_ability_2.description: Passive:  Rengar stores grey health equal to a portion of damage taken within a brief moment.
basic_ability_2.description_source: Grey health will not be consumed upon casting Battle Roar despite visually appearing so. It will only ever expire after its duration ends.

basic_ability_3.name: Bola Strike
basic_ability_3.description: Active:  Rengar throws a bola in the target direction that deals  physical damage and briefly  slows the first enemy hit,  revealing them for a short time.
basic_ability_3.description_source:
If Rengar casts  Savagery and/or  Battle Roar during Bola Strike's cast time, he will buffer them and cast them when Bola Strike completes.
This ability will cast from wherever the caster is at the end of the cast time.
Bola Strike's end point will not move in relation to Rengar if he moves during the cast time.

ultimate.name: Thrill of the Hunt
ultimate.description: Passive:  Rengar also gains  Unseen Predator while  camouflaged.
ultimate.description_source:
Thrill of the Hunt's duration starts on-cast.
The armor reduction applies after the attack.
If the attack out of Thrill of the Hunt is prevented or blocked (e.g. by  knocking down Rengar when  leaping) then the effect will not be applied.
The  true sight reveal on the target stays until the leap finishes.
Rengar discerns a distinct  heart beat instead of the usual  true sight indicator. This indicator will be removed when out of range, but the target will remain revealed.
Using a basic attack  breaks the stealth at the end of the attack windup.
Thrill of the Hunt has an indicator that appears above the target(s) when Rengar is nearby. Some skins have a unique indicator.
